required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: "REDUCE" - A Clinical Research Study To Reduce The Incidence Of Prostate Cancer In Men Who Are At Increased Risk
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized, Double-Blind, Placebo-Controlled, Parallel Group Study of the Efficacy and Safety of Dutasteride 0.5 mg Administered Orally Once Daily for Four Years to Reduce the Risk of Biopsy-Detectable Prostate Cancer

brief_summary.textblock: This 4-year study will compare how safe and effective an oral investigational medicine is (compared to placebo) in preventing the development of prostate cancer in men that are defined by the study entrance criteria as being at an increased risk for prostate cancer. Study visits to the clinic will occur every 6 months for up to 4 years (10 clinic visits), and a prostate biopsy will be performed at 2 and 4 years of treatment.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Biopsy-detectable Prostate Cancer at Years 2 and 4 (Crude Rate Approach)
primary_outcome.description: Study biopsies consisted of 10 biopsy samples (cores) in a pre-defined pattern. Biopsies were read at the central pathology laboratory (CPL, which processed the majority, 94%, of biopsies). Biopsy cases that were positive for prostate cancer or precancerous lesions (high-grade prostatic intraepithelial neoplasia[HGPIN] or typical small acinar proliferation [ASAP]) and prostate surgeries were reviewed by the lead pathologist.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Biopsy-detectable Prostate Cancer at Years 2 and 4 (Modified Crude Rate Approach)
primary_outcome.description: Study biopsies (biop.) consisted of 10 biop. samples (cores) in a pre-defined pattern and were read at the central pathology laboratory. Biop. cases that were positive for prostate cancer or precancerous lesions (HGPIN or ASAP) and prostate surgeries were reviewed by the lead pathologist. Participants included in the risk sets at Years 1-2 and Years 3-4 included those with a positive biop. at Years 1-2 or a biop. after Months 18-24, and those with a positive biop. at Years 3-4 or a biop. after Month 42, respectively. Overall included participants with a positive biop. or biop. after Month 42.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Biopsy-detectable Prostate Cancer at Years 2 and 4 (Restricted Crude Rate Approach)
primary_outcome.description: Study biopsies consisted of 10 biopsy samples (cores) in a pre-defined pattern. Biopsies were read at the central pathology laboratory (which processed the majority, 94%, of biopsies). Biopsy cases that were positive for prostate cancer or precancerous lesions (HGPIN or ASAP) and prostate surgeries were reviewed by the lead pathologist. Participants included in the risk set at Years 1-2, Years 3-4, and Overall (Years 1-4) were those who had a biopsy during the specified time period.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With the Indicated Gleason Score at Diagnosis
secondary_outcome.description: Gleason score was determined by examining prostate biopsies and surgical samples. The Gleason scoring system sums the two most common Gleason grade patterns in order to predict the likelihood of a participant doing well or badly with their cancer. Gleason grades range from 1 (normal) to 5 (advanced cancer). The lowest Gleason score is 2 (1+1), and the highest Gleason score is 10 (5+5). A Gleason score of 2-6 is a low-grade cancer; a Gleason score of 7-10 is high-grade cancer. The most severe high-grade cancers are the subset of Gleason scores 8-10.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With HGPIN, ASAP, and Prostate Cancer at Biopsy
secondary_outcome.description: The occurrence and quantity of high-grade prostatic intraepithelial neoplasia (HGPIN) and atypical small acinar proliferation (ASAP) at biopsy were measured. HGPIN and ASAP are considered precancerous conditions. A participant diagnosed with prostate cancer only (i.e., no HGPIN or ASAP) was counted in both the first category ("HGPIN or prostate cancer diagnosis") and again in the last category ("HGPIN, ASAP, or prostate cancer diagnosis").

secondary_outcome.measure: Volume of HGPIN at Biopsy
secondary_outcome.description: The amount of prostate biopsy tissue with HGPIN was measured.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Core Involved at Diagnosis
secondary_outcome.description: The average amount of cancer seen by the pathologist in the prostate tissue samples taken during the biopsy was measured. A core is a prostate biopsy sample.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Cancer-positive Cores
secondary_outcome.description: The average number of prostate biopsy samples (cores) determined to be cancerous by the pathologist was measured. Normally, 10 cores were taken per biopsy for each participant.

secondary_outcome.measure: Treatment Alteration Score
secondary_outcome.description: The treatment alteration score is a measure of the cellular changes due to treatment (effect of male hormone withdrawal) on the nucleus and cytoplasm of the prostate cancer cell. The treatment alteration score is the sum of two scores (the nuclear alteration score and the cytoplasmic architectural score), each ranging from 0 to 3, with 0 indicating no change and 3 indicating severe changes.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Undergoing Intervention (Surgical and Non-surgical) for Prostate Cancer Treatment
secondary_outcome.description: The number of participants who received treatment for prostate cancer was measured. Prostate cancer interventions included surgical interventions (e.g., prostatectomy, adenomectomy, transurethral resection) and non-surgical interventions (e.g., chemotherapy, hormone therapy, radiation therapy).

secondary_outcome.measure: Adjusted Mean Change From Baseline in the International Prostate Symptom Score (IPSS) at Month 48
secondary_outcome.description: The IPSS is a 7-item questionnaire that measures urinary symptoms. It measures the level of urinary symptoms (including incomplete emptying, frequency, intermittency, urgency, weak stream, straining, and nocturia) reported as the total IPSS score. Each of the 7 questions has a 6-point response scale (0=none/not at all to 5=almost always) with a total score that can range from 0-35: mild (0-7), moderate (8-19), or severe (20-35). Estimates are based on adjusted means from the general linear model: change from baseline = baseline value and cluster and treatment.

secondary_outcome.measure: Adjusted Mean Percentage Change From Baseline in Prostate Volume at Months 24 and 48
secondary_outcome.description: Prostate volume was measured by transrectal ultrasound (TRUS) when biopsies were performed at Year 2 and Year 4. The investigator calculated the prostate volume using three prostate measurements (anteroposterior, cephalocaudal, and transverse diameters). Estimates are based on the adjusted means from the general linear model: log(Post-Baseline/Baseline value) = treatment and cluster and log (baseline value).

secondary_outcome.measure: Adjusted Mean Change From Baseline in Maximum Urinary Flow (Qmax) at Months 12, 24, 36, and 48
secondary_outcome.description: Maximum urinary flow was measured at selected sites using a Dantec Uroflow meter with a Thompson filter. Change from baseline was calculated as Month 12, 24, 36, and 48 values minus the baseline value. Estimates are based on the adjusted means from the general linear model: change from baseline = baseline Qmax and treatment. This measurement was performed at selected centers.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Starting Alpha Blockers to Control Benign Prostatic Hyperplasia (BPH) Symptoms
secondary_outcome.description: Medication taken during the study, including alpha blockers, was recorded at each 6-month study visit and during phone calls that occurred 3 months after each visit.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With at Least One Event of Acute Urinary Retention (AUR)
secondary_outcome.description: A participant was considered to have AUR when he reported being unable to urinate and required catherization. Participants were asked to report any events of AUR during the study.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With at Least One Urinary Tract Infection (UTI)
secondary_outcome.description: A participant was considered to have a UTI if the investigator noted that the participant had UTI symptoms and had been prescribed antibiotics. Participants were asked to report any events of UTI during the study.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Post-biopsy Macroscopic Hematuria
secondary_outcome.description: Participants reported events of macroscopic hematuria (visible blood in the urine) throughout the study.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Post-biopsy Macroscopic Hematospermia
secondary_outcome.description: Participants reported events of macroscopic hematospermia (visible blood in semen) throughout the study.

secondary_outcome.measure: Overall Survival
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From time informed consent is signed to 4-month Safety Follow-Up period
secondary_outcome.description: Overall survival is assessed as the number of deaths reported throughout the study.

secondary_outcome.measure: Adjusted Mean Change From Baseline in the Benign Prostatic Hypertrophy (BPH) Impact Index (BII) at Month 48
secondary_outcome.description: The BII is a 4-item questionnaire that rates the level of BPH-related physical discomfort, worry, and interference with normal activities the participant has experienced. The total BII score ranges from 1 (no impact on symptoms) to 13 (major impact on symptoms). Participants completed the questionnaire at Baseline and at each 6-month visit. Participants whose language did not have a validated translation of the questionnaire did not participate. Estimates are based on the adjusted means from the general linear model:change from baseline = baseline value and cluster and treatment.

secondary_outcome.measure: Adjusted Mean Change From Baseline in The Medical Outcomes Study Sleep Problems Index 6-item Standard Version (MOS Sleep-6S) at Month 48
secondary_outcome.description: The MOS Sleep-6S is a 6-item questionnaire measuring quality of sleep. Scores range from 1 (all of the time) to 6 (none of the time) and are converted to a 1-100 scale and then averaged; a higher score indicates greater negative impact, which indicates more sleep disturbance. Participants completed the questionnaire at Baseline and at each 6-month visit. Participants whose language did not have a validated translation of the questionnaire did not participate. Estimates are based on the adjusted means from the general linear model: change from baseline=baseline value and cluster and treatment.

secondary_outcome.measure: Adjusted Mean Change From Baseline in the National Institutes of Health Chronic Prostatitis Symptom Index (NIH CPSI) at Month 48
secondary_outcome.description: The NIH CSPI is a 9-item questionnaire that measures chronic prostatitis symptoms. The total score ranges from 0 to 43. A higher score indicates greater negative impact of prostatitis. Participants completed the questionnaire at Baseline and at each 6-month visit. Participants whose language did not have a validated translation of the questionnaire did not participate. Estimates are based on the adjusted means from the general linear model: change from Baseline = Baseline Value and Cluster and Treatment.

secondary_outcome.measure: Adjusted Mean Change From Baseline in Quality of Life Question 8 (QOL Q8) at Month 48
secondary_outcome.description: The QOL Q8 is the last question of the IPSS Questionnaire. It is a question about the participant's quality of life as it relates to prostate symptoms. Responses range from 0 (most positive) to 6 (most negative). A higher score indicates worse quality of life. Participants completed the questionnaire at Screening, Baseline, and at each 6-month visit. Estimates are based on the adjusted means from the general linear model: change from baseline = baseline value and cluster and treatment.

secondary_outcome.measure: Adjusted Mean Change From Baseline in the Problem Assessment Scale of the Sexual Function Index (PASSFI) at Month 48
secondary_outcome.description: The PASSFI is a 3-item questionnaire that measures sexual function. Responses range from 0 (big problem) to 4 (no problem), with a total score of 12. A higher score indicates fewer problems with sexual functioning. Participants completed the questionnaire at Baseline and then yearly . Participants whose language did not have a validated translation of the questionnaire did not participate. Estimates are based on the adjusted means from the general linear model: change from baseline = baseline value and cluster and treatment.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With the Indicated Serum Dihydrotestosterone (DHT) Concentration at Month 48
secondary_outcome.description: Number of participants whose DHT, the active form of the male sex hormone testosterone, was less than 0.555 nanomoles/liter and below the level of detection at Month 48 was measured. It was measured by taking blood samples at screening and yearly thereafter.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Change From Baseline in Testosterone at Month 48
secondary_outcome.description: Testosterone, a male sex hormone, was measured by taking blood samples at screening and yearly thereafter.

arm_group.description: Eligible subjects will complete a 4-week placebo run-in followed by randomization to matched placebo in a 1:1 ratio.
Eligible subjects will complete a 4-week placebo run-in followed by randomization to 0.5mg dutasteride in a 1:1 ratio. Randomization will be stratified by center.

intervention.description: After successful completion of the placebo run-in phase, subjects who continue to meet eligibility requirements will be randomized into the double-blind phase of the study and issued a 6-month supply of study drug. Subjects will self-administer study drug once daily dosing of 0.5mg of dutasteride orally for up to 4 years.

After successful completion of the placebo run-in phase, subjects who continue to meet eligibility requirements will be randomized into the double-blind phase of the study and issued a 6-month supply of study drug. Subjects will self-administer study drug once daily orally for up to 4 years.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion criteria:
- Informed consent to participate in study.
- Have had a single negative prostate biopsy within 6 months prior to enrollment in study.
- Have a PSA (prostate specific antigen) between 2.5 and 10 if 50-60 years of age; or a PSA between 3.0 and 10 if over age 60.
- Ability and will to participate in study for 4 years.
Exclusion criteria:
- More than one previous negative prostate biopsy.
- History of prostate cancer.
- Previous prostate surgery.
- Inability to urinate requiring the need of a catheter during the previous 2 years.
- Any condition (other than benign prostatic hypertrophy) which may result in urinary symptoms or changes in urine flow rate.
- Cancer within previous 5 years (other than basal or squamous cell cancers of the skin).
- Any unstable serious medical condition.
- Use within the past 12 months of finasteride (Proscar or Propecia), dutasteride (Avodart), testosterone, or drugs that can block the action of male hormones.

link.description: Researchers can use this site to request access to anonymised patient level data and/or supporting documents from clinical studies to conduct further research.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Placebo, repeat oral once daily dosing for 4 years. Placebo supplied as matching dutasteride capsules.

group.title: Dutasteride 0.5 mg
group.description: Dutasteride 0.5 milligrams (mg), repeat oral once daily dosing for 4 years. Dutasteride supplied as gelatin capsule.

group.description: Placebo, repeat oral once daily dosing for 4 years. Placebo supplied as matching dutasteride capsules.

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Biopsy-detectable Prostate Cancer at Years 2 and 4 (Crude Rate Approach)
outcome.description: Study biopsies consisted of 10 biopsy samples (cores) in a pre-defined pattern. Biopsies were read at the central pathology laboratory (CPL, which processed the majority, 94%, of biopsies). Biopsy cases that were positive for prostate cancer or precancerous lesions (high-grade prostatic intraepithelial neoplasia[HGPIN] or typical small acinar proliferation [ASAP]) and prostate surgeries were reviewed by the lead pathologist.
outcome.population: Efficacy Population: all randomized participants with a negative entry biopsy, as determined by the CPL, who received at least 1 dose of study drug. The crude rate approach included all participants at risk at the beginning of each time period .

group.description: Placebo, repeat oral once daily dosing for 4 years. Placebo supplied as matching dutasteride capsules.

group.title: Dutasteride 0.5 mg
group.description: Dutasteride 0.5 milligrams (mg), repeat oral once daily dosing for 4 years. Dutasteride supplied as gelatin capsule.

measure.title: Number of Participants With Biopsy-detectable Prostate Cancer at Years 2 and 4 (Crude Rate Approach)
measure.description: Study biopsies consisted of 10 biopsy samples (cores) in a pre-defined pattern. Biopsies were read at the central pathology laboratory (CPL, which processed the majority, 94%, of biopsies). Biopsy cases that were positive for prostate cancer or precancerous lesions (high-grade prostatic intraepithelial neoplasia[HGPIN] or typical small acinar proliferation [ASAP]) and prostate surgeries were reviewed by the lead pathologist.
measure.population: Efficacy Population: all randomized participants with a negative entry biopsy, as determined by the CPL, who received at least 1 dose of study drug. The crude rate approach included all participants at risk at the beginning of each time period .

analysis.p_value_desc: The p value is given is for the overall assessment.
analysis.estimate_desc: Estimation data given are for the overall assessment.

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Biopsy-detectable Prostate Cancer at Years 2 and 4 (Modified Crude Rate Approach)
outcome.description: Study biopsies (biop.) consisted of 10 biop. samples (cores) in a pre-defined pattern and were read at the central pathology laboratory. Biop. cases that were positive for prostate cancer or precancerous lesions (HGPIN or ASAP) and prostate surgeries were reviewed by the lead pathologist. Participants included in the risk sets at Years 1-2 and Years 3-4 included those with a positive biop. at Years 1-2 or a biop. after Months 18-24, and those with a positive biop. at Years 3-4 or a biop. after Month 42, respectively. Overall included participants with a positive biop. or biop. after Month 42.
outcome.population: Efficacy Population, modified crude rate: participants who either were diagnosed with prostate cancer during the study or had an end of time period biopsy. N for each time period is the number who either had at least 1 biopsy in the final 6 months of the time period or had a positive biopsy anytime during the time period.

measure.title: Number of Participants With Biopsy-detectable Prostate Cancer at Years 2 and 4 (Modified Crude Rate Approach)
measure.description: Study biopsies (biop.) consisted of 10 biop. samples (cores) in a pre-defined pattern and were read at the central pathology laboratory. Biop. cases that were positive for prostate cancer or precancerous lesions (HGPIN or ASAP) and prostate surgeries were reviewed by the lead pathologist. Participants included in the risk sets at Years 1-2 and Years 3-4 included those with a positive biop. at Years 1-2 or a biop. after Months 18-24, and those with a positive biop. at Years 3-4 or a biop. after Month 42, respectively. Overall included participants with a positive biop. or biop. after Month 42.
measure.population: Efficacy Population, modified crude rate: participants who either were diagnosed with prostate cancer during the study or had an end of time period biopsy. N for each time period is the number who either had at least 1 biopsy in the final 6 months of the time period or had a positive biopsy anytime during the time period.

analysis.p_value_desc: The p value is given is for the overall assessment.
analysis.estimate_desc: Estimation data are given are for the overall assessment.

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Biopsy-detectable Prostate Cancer at Years 2 and 4 (Restricted Crude Rate Approach)
outcome.description: Study biopsies consisted of 10 biopsy samples (cores) in a pre-defined pattern. Biopsies were read at the central pathology laboratory (which processed the majority, 94%, of biopsies). Biopsy cases that were positive for prostate cancer or precancerous lesions (HGPIN or ASAP) and prostate surgeries were reviewed by the lead pathologist. Participants included in the risk set at Years 1-2, Years 3-4, and Overall (Years 1-4) were those who had a biopsy during the specified time period.
outcome.population: Efficacy Population, restricted crude rate: the number of prostate cancer events is based on the the number of participants who had at least one biopsy during the time period. Ns at Years 1-2 and Years 3-4 are the number who had a biopsy in those time periods; the overall n is the number of participants who had 1 or more biopsy during Years 1-4.

analysis.p_value_desc: The p value is given for the overall assessment.
analysis.estimate_desc: Estimation data are given for the overall assessment.

outcome.title: Number of Participants With the Indicated Gleason Score at Diagnosis
outcome.description: Gleason score was determined by examining prostate biopsies and surgical samples. The Gleason scoring system sums the two most common Gleason grade patterns in order to predict the likelihood of a participant doing well or badly with their cancer. Gleason grades range from 1 (normal) to 5 (advanced cancer). The lowest Gleason score is 2 (1+1), and the highest Gleason score is 10 (5+5). A Gleason score of 2-6 is a low-grade cancer; a Gleason score of 7-10 is high-grade cancer. The most severe high-grade cancers are the subset of Gleason scores 8-10.
outcome.population: Biopsied Population: all randomized participants with a negative entry biopsy who received at least 1 dose of study treatment and who had at least 1 biopsy reviewed by the central pathology lab. Only needle biopsies are included (surgeries are excluded). The number analyzed is smaller than the total number in the population due to missing values.

measure.title: Number of Participants With the Indicated Gleason Score at Diagnosis
measure.description: Gleason score was determined by examining prostate biopsies and surgical samples. The Gleason scoring system sums the two most common Gleason grade patterns in order to predict the likelihood of a participant doing well or badly with their cancer. Gleason grades range from 1 (normal) to 5 (advanced cancer). The lowest Gleason score is 2 (1+1), and the highest Gleason score is 10 (5+5). A Gleason score of 2-6 is a low-grade cancer; a Gleason score of 7-10 is high-grade cancer. The most severe high-grade cancers are the subset of Gleason scores 8-10.
measure.population: Biopsied Population: all randomized participants with a negative entry biopsy who received at least 1 dose of study treatment and who had at least 1 biopsy reviewed by the central pathology lab. Only needle biopsies are included (surgeries are excluded). The number analyzed is smaller than the total number in the population due to missing values.

outcome.title: Number of Participants With HGPIN, ASAP, and Prostate Cancer at Biopsy
outcome.description: The occurrence and quantity of high-grade prostatic intraepithelial neoplasia (HGPIN) and atypical small acinar proliferation (ASAP) at biopsy were measured. HGPIN and ASAP are considered precancerous conditions. A participant diagnosed with prostate cancer only (i.e., no HGPIN or ASAP) was counted in both the first category ("HGPIN or prostate cancer diagnosis") and again in the last category ("HGPIN, ASAP, or prostate cancer diagnosis").
outcome.population: Biopsied Population: the number analyzed is the total number in the population

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Placebo, repeat oral once daily dosing for 4 years. Placebo supplied as matching dutasteride capsules.

group.title: Dutasteride 0.5 mg
group.description: Dutasteride 0.5 milligrams (mg), repeat oral once daily dosing for 4 years. Dutasteride supplied as gelatin capsule.

measure.description: The occurrence and quantity of high-grade prostatic intraepithelial neoplasia (HGPIN) and atypical small acinar proliferation (ASAP) at biopsy were measured. HGPIN and ASAP are considered precancerous conditions. A participant diagnosed with prostate cancer only (i.e., no HGPIN or ASAP) was counted in both the first category ("HGPIN or prostate cancer diagnosis") and again in the last category ("HGPIN, ASAP, or prostate cancer diagnosis").
measure.population: Biopsied Population: the number analyzed is the total number in the population

class.title: HGPIN and no ASAP and no prostate cancer
HGPIN or ASAP and no prostate cancer
HGPIN, ASAP, or prostate cancer diagnosis

outcome.title: Volume of HGPIN at Biopsy
outcome.description: The amount of prostate biopsy tissue with HGPIN was measured.
outcome.population: Biopsied Population. Only needle biopsies are included (surgeries are excluded). The number analyzed is smaller than the total number in the population due to missing values.

measure.population: Biopsied Population. Only needle biopsies are included (surgeries are excluded). The number analyzed is smaller than the total number in the population due to missing values.

outcome.title: Percentage of Core Involved at Diagnosis
outcome.description: The average amount of cancer seen by the pathologist in the prostate tissue samples taken during the biopsy was measured. A core is a prostate biopsy sample.
outcome.population: Prostate Cancer Population: all participants in the Efficacy Population who received a post-baseline diagnosis of prostate cancer by the central pathology laboratory. Only needle biopsies are included (surgeries are excluded). The number analyzed is smaller than the total number in the population due to missing values.

group.description: Placebo, repeat oral once daily dosing for 4 years. Placebo supplied as matching dutasteride capsules.

measure.title: Percentage of Core Involved at Diagnosis
measure.description: The average amount of cancer seen by the pathologist in the prostate tissue samples taken during the biopsy was measured. A core is a prostate biopsy sample.
measure.population: Prostate Cancer Population: all participants in the Efficacy Population who received a post-baseline diagnosis of prostate cancer by the central pathology laboratory. Only needle biopsies are included (surgeries are excluded). The number analyzed is smaller than the total number in the population due to missing values.

outcome.title: Number of Cancer-positive Cores
outcome.description: The average number of prostate biopsy samples (cores) determined to be cancerous by the pathologist was measured. Normally, 10 cores were taken per biopsy for each participant.
outcome.population: Prostate Cancer Population. Only needle biopsies are included (surgeries are excluded). The number analyzed is smaller than the total number in the population due to missing values.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Placebo, repeat oral once daily dosing for 4 years. Placebo supplied as matching dutasteride capsules.

group.description: Dutasteride 0.5 milligrams (mg), repeat oral once daily dosing for 4 years. Dutasteride supplied as gelatin capsule.

measure.title: Number of Cancer-positive Cores
measure.description: The average number of prostate biopsy samples (cores) determined to be cancerous by the pathologist was measured. Normally, 10 cores were taken per biopsy for each participant.
measure.population: Prostate Cancer Population. Only needle biopsies are included (surgeries are excluded). The number analyzed is smaller than the total number in the population due to missing values.

outcome.title: Treatment Alteration Score
outcome.description: The treatment alteration score is a measure of the cellular changes due to treatment (effect of male hormone withdrawal) on the nucleus and cytoplasm of the prostate cancer cell. The treatment alteration score is the sum of two scores (the nuclear alteration score and the cytoplasmic architectural score), each ranging from 0 to 3, with 0 indicating no change and 3 indicating severe changes.
outcome.population: Biopsied Population. Only needle biopsies are included (surgeries are excluded). The number analyzed is smaller than the total number in the population due to missing values.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Placebo, repeat oral once daily dosing for 4 years. Placebo supplied as matching dutasteride capsules.

group.title: Dutasteride 0.5 mg
group.description: Dutasteride 0.5 milligrams (mg), repeat oral once daily dosing for 4 years. Dutasteride supplied as gelatin capsule.

measure.title: Treatment Alteration Score
measure.description: The treatment alteration score is a measure of the cellular changes due to treatment (effect of male hormone withdrawal) on the nucleus and cytoplasm of the prostate cancer cell. The treatment alteration score is the sum of two scores (the nuclear alteration score and the cytoplasmic architectural score), each ranging from 0 to 3, with 0 indicating no change and 3 indicating severe changes.
measure.population: Biopsied Population. Only needle biopsies are included (surgeries are excluded). The number analyzed is smaller than the total number in the population due to missing values.

outcome.title: Number of Participants Undergoing Intervention (Surgical and Non-surgical) for Prostate Cancer Treatment
outcome.description: The number of participants who received treatment for prostate cancer was measured. Prostate cancer interventions included surgical interventions (e.g., prostatectomy, adenomectomy, transurethral resection) and non-surgical interventions (e.g., chemotherapy, hormone therapy, radiation therapy).
outcome.population: Efficacy Population

measure.description: The number of participants who received treatment for prostate cancer was measured. measure.population: Efficacy Population

outcome.title: Adjusted Mean Change From Baseline in the International Prostate Symptom Score (IPSS) at Month 48
outcome.description: The IPSS is a 7-item questionnaire that measures urinary symptoms. It measures the level of urinary symptoms (including incomplete emptying, frequency, intermittency, urgency, weak stream, straining, and nocturia) reported as the total IPSS score. Each of the 7 questions has a 6-point response scale (0=none/not at all to 5=almost always) with a total score that can range from 0-35: mild (0-7), moderate (8-19), or severe (20-35). Estimates are based on adjusted means from the general linear model: change from baseline = baseline value and cluster and treatment.
outcome.population: Efficacy Population, last observation carried forward (LOCF). In the LOCF approach, missing values at post-baseline assessments are replaced with the participant's previous non-missing post-baseline assessment. The number analyzed is smaller than the total number in the population due to missing values.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Placebo, repeat oral once daily dosing for 4 years. Placebo supplied as matching dutasteride capsules.

measure.title: Adjusted Mean Change From Baseline in the International Prostate Symptom Score (IPSS) at Month 48
measure.description: The IPSS is a 7-item questionnaire that measures urinary symptoms. It measures the level of urinary symptoms (including incomplete emptying, frequency, intermittency, urgency, weak stream, straining, and nocturia) reported as the total IPSS score. Each of the 7 questions has a 6-point response scale (0=none/not at all to 5=almost always) with a total score that can range from 0-35: mild (0-7), moderate (8-19), or severe (20-35). Estimates are based on adjusted means from the general linear model: change from baseline = baseline value and cluster and treatment.

outcome.title: Adjusted Mean Percentage Change From Baseline in Prostate Volume at Months 24 and 48
outcome.description: Prostate volume was measured by transrectal ultrasound (TRUS) when biopsies were performed at Year 2 and Year 4. The investigator calculated the prostate volume using three prostate measurements (anteroposterior, cephalocaudal, and transverse diameters). Estimates are based on the adjusted means from the general linear model: log(Post-Baseline/Baseline value) = treatment and cluster and log (baseline value).
outcome.population: Efficacy Population (LOCF). The number analyzed is smaller than the total number in the population due to missing values.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Placebo, repeat oral once daily dosing for 4 years. Placebo supplied as matching dutasteride capsules.

group.title: Dutasteride 0.5 mg
group.description: Dutasteride 0.5 milligrams (mg), repeat oral once daily dosing for 4 years. Dutasteride supplied as gelatin capsule.

measure.title: Adjusted Mean Percentage Change From Baseline in Prostate Volume at Months 24 and 48
measure.description: Prostate volume was measured by transrectal ultrasound (TRUS) when biopsies were performed at Year 2 and Year 4. The investigator calculated the prostate volume using three prostate measurements (anteroposterior, cephalocaudal, and transverse diameters). Estimates are based on the adjusted means from the general linear model: log(Post-Baseline/Baseline value) = treatment and cluster and log (baseline value).
measure.population: Efficacy Population (LOCF). The number analyzed is smaller than the total number in the population due to missing values.

outcome.title: Adjusted Mean Change From Baseline in Maximum Urinary Flow (Qmax) at Months 12, 24, 36, and 48
outcome.description: Maximum urinary flow was measured at selected sites using a Dantec Uroflow meter with a Thompson filter. Change from baseline was calculated as Month 12, 24, 36, and 48 values minus the baseline value. Estimates are based on the adjusted means from the general linear model: change from baseline = baseline Qmax and treatment. This measurement was performed at selected centers.
outcome.population: Efficacy Population (LOCF). The number analyzed is smaller than the total number in the population due to missing values.

outcome.description: A participant was considered to have AUR when he reported being unable to urinate and required catherization. Participants were asked to report any events of AUR during the study.
outcome.population: Efficacy Population

outcome.title: Adjusted Mean Change From Baseline in the Benign Prostatic Hypertrophy (BPH) Impact Index (BII) at Month 48
outcome.description: The BII is a 4-item questionnaire that rates the level of BPH-related physical discomfort, worry, and interference with normal activities the participant has experienced. The total BII score ranges from 1 (no impact on symptoms) to 13 (major impact on symptoms). Participants completed the questionnaire at Baseline and at each 6-month visit. Participants whose language did not have a validated translation of the questionnaire did not participate. Estimates are based on the adjusted means from the general linear model:change from baseline = baseline value and cluster and treatment.
outcome.population: Efficacy Population (LOCF). The numbers presented are less than the overall population, as data were not available for all participants.

measure.title: Adjusted Mean Change From Baseline in the Benign Prostatic Hypertrophy (BPH) Impact Index (BII) at Month 48
measure.description: The BII is a 4-item questionnaire that rates the level of BPH-related physical discomfort, worry, and interference with normal activities the participant has experienced. The total BII score ranges from 1 (no impact on symptoms) to 13 (major impact on symptoms). Participants completed the questionnaire at Baseline and at each 6-month visit. Participants whose language did not have a validated translation of the questionnaire did not participate. Estimates are based on the adjusted means from the general linear model:change from baseline = baseline value and cluster and treatment.
measure.population: Efficacy Population (LOCF). The numbers presented are less than the overall population, as data were not available for all participants.

outcome.title: Adjusted Mean Change From Baseline in The Medical Outcomes Study Sleep Problems Index 6-item Standard Version (MOS Sleep-6S) at Month 48
outcome.description: The MOS Sleep-6S is a 6-item questionnaire measuring quality of sleep. Scores range from 1 (all of the time) to 6 (none of the time) and are converted to a 1-100 scale and then averaged; a higher score indicates greater negative impact, which indicates more sleep disturbance. Participants completed the questionnaire at Baseline and at each 6-month visit. Participants whose language did not have a validated translation of the questionnaire did not participate. Estimates are based on the adjusted means from the general linear model: change from baseline=baseline value and cluster and treatment.
outcome.population: Efficacy Population (LOCF). The numbers presented are less than the overall population, as data were not available for all participants.

measure.title: Adjusted Mean Change From Baseline in The Medical Outcomes Study Sleep Problems Index 6-item Standard Version (MOS Sleep-6S) at Month 48
measure.description: The MOS Sleep-6S is a 6-item questionnaire measuring quality of sleep. Participants completed the questionnaire at Baseline and at each 6-month visit. Participants whose language did not have a validated translation of the questionnaire did not participate. Estimates are based on the adjusted means from the general linear model: change from baseline=baseline value and cluster and treatment.
measure.population: Efficacy Population (LOCF). The numbers presented are less than the overall population, as data were not available for all participants.

outcome.title: Adjusted Mean Change From Baseline in the National Institutes of Health Chronic Prostatitis Symptom Index (NIH CPSI) at Month 48
outcome.description: The NIH CSPI is a 9-item questionnaire that measures chronic prostatitis symptoms. The total score ranges from 0 to 43. A higher score indicates greater negative impact of prostatitis. Participants completed the questionnaire at Baseline and at each 6-month visit. Participants whose language did not have a validated translation of the questionnaire did not participate. Estimates are based on the adjusted means from the general linear model: change from Baseline = Baseline Value and Cluster and Treatment.
outcome.population: Efficacy Population (LOCF). The numbers presented are less than the overall population, as data were not available for all participants.

measure.description: The NIH CSPI is a 9-item questionnaire that measures chronic prostatitis symptoms. The total score ranges from 0 to 43. A higher score indicates greater negative impact of prostatitis. Participants completed the questionnaire at Baseline and at each 6-month visit. outcome.title: Adjusted Mean Change From Baseline in Quality of Life Question 8 (QOL Q8) at Month 48
outcome.description: The QOL Q8 is the last question of the IPSS Questionnaire. It is a question about the participant's quality of life as it relates to prostate symptoms. Responses range from 0 (most positive) to 6 (most negative). A higher score indicates worse quality of life. Participants completed the questionnaire at Screening, Baseline, and at each 6-month visit. Estimates are based on the adjusted means from the general linear model: change from baseline = baseline value and cluster and treatment.
outcome.population: Efficacy Population (LOCF). The number analyzed is smaller than the total number in the population due to missing values.

measure.description: The QOL Q8 is the last question of the IPSS Questionnaire. It is a question about the participant's quality of life as it relates to prostate symptoms. Responses range from 0 (most positive) to 6 (most negative). A higher score indicates worse quality of life. Participants completed the questionnaire at Screening, Baseline, and at each 6-month visit. Estimates are based on the adjusted means from the general linear model: change from baseline = baseline value and cluster and treatment.
measure.population: Efficacy Population (LOCF). The number analyzed is smaller than the total number in the population due to missing values.

outcome.title: Adjusted Mean Change From Baseline in the Problem Assessment Scale of the Sexual Function Index (PASSFI) at Month 48
outcome.description: The PASSFI is a 3-item questionnaire that measures sexual function. Responses range from 0 (big problem) to 4 (no problem), with a total score of 12. A higher score indicates fewer problems with sexual functioning. Participants completed the questionnaire at Baseline and then yearly . Participants whose language did not have a validated translation of the questionnaire did not participate. Estimates are based on the adjusted means from the general linear model: change from baseline = baseline value and cluster and treatment.
outcome.population: Efficacy Population (LOCF). The number analyzed is smaller than the total number in the population due to missing values.

A higher score indicates fewer problems with sexual functioning. Participants completed the questionnaire at Baseline and then yearly . Participants whose language did not have a validated translation of the questionnaire did not participate. Estimates are based on the adjusted means from the general linear model: change from baseline = baseline value and cluster and treatment.

outcome.title: Number of Participants With the Indicated Serum Dihydrotestosterone (DHT) Concentration at Month 48
outcome.description: Number of participants whose DHT, the active form of the male sex hormone testosterone, was less than 0.555 nanomoles/liter and below the level of detection at Month 48 was measured. It was measured by taking blood samples at screening and yearly thereafter.
outcome.population: Efficacy Population (LOCF). The number analyzed is smaller than the total number in the population due to missing values.

analysis.estimate_desc: The adjusted mean difference was calculated as the difference between the adjusted means (-6.1 and 12.7) for the placebo and Dutasteride arms, respectively.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: GSK agreements may vary with individual investigators, but will not prohibit any investigator from publishing. GSK supports the publication of results from all centers of a multi-center trial but requests that reports based on single-site data not precede the primary publication of the entire clinical trial.
